page.title: 01Introduction to Cranbrook
page.content: Cranbrook lies on the edge of the weald of Kent 15 miles south of Maidstone.The town is situated in the valley of the Crane brook.It is surrounded by belts of mixed woodland and open farmland.The oldest part of the town,with its variety of weatherboard,tiled,and timber framed buildings,is located on either side of the high street and stone street.No mention is found in the Domesday book,but Cranbrook is linked historically with the woollen and iron industries.Today's landmarks include the church of St Dunstans,the Cathedral of the Weald,and the Windmill. Cranbrook has always been regarded as an administrative,commercial and educational centre for the surrounding villages.Today Cranbrook places great importance on conservation,and developing the area for Tourism
